intro: Campomanesia laurifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree or cipó-de-ferro, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite and lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests.
